did.abstract: The Liam O'Flaherty Darkness manuscripts (dated circa 1925; 0.02 cubic feet; 2 folders) comprise two original Irish manuscripts of the three-act tragic play Dorchadas, known as Darkness in English, that Liam O'Flaherty wrote and was performed at the Abbey Theatre in Dublin in 1926.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Liam O'Flaherty (1896-1984) was an Irish author known for writing novels, plays and short stories during the period of Irish literary renaissance following Irish independence in 1921. O'Flaherty chose to write about controversial subjects, such as war, famine, independence, and religion, and five of his works were censored by the Irish Censorship of Publications Board. The first novel to be censored in Ireland was O'Flaherty's novel The House of Gold, in 1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Liam O'Flaherty Darkness manuscripts (dated circa 1925; 0.02 cubic feet; 2 folders) comprise two original Irish manuscripts of the three-act tragic play Dorchadas, known as Darkness in English, that Liam O'Flaherty wrote and was performed at the Abbey Theatre in Dublin in 1926. The manuscripts are handwritten in the Irish language in two red notebooks that are labeled as exercise books. One notebook contains acts two and three, while the other notebook contains all three acts of the play.
